Introduction to the Data Model

Lesson
objectives

+ Describe the contents of a Guidewire Data

Model

* Identify information about a given

application's Data Model

- Use the Data Dictionary

| The Guidewire Data Model G

¢ The Guidewire data model is a set of

XML-formatted metadata definitions of Database Application Server
entities and typelists ABContact generated Java class
* The Guidewire application loads the x2} >atnao mn | 28Contact

Name
PublicID

Data Model on start-up Createtime

¢ The loaded metadata:

« instantiates the Data Model as a collection

CreateTime

of tables in the application database [name | Pubii>] cresterime_| Gosu code
* injects generated Java and Gosu classes in

the application server to provide a

programmatic interface to entities and ©

typelists in the database

| Data Model entities

Gi

¢ Entities are the high-level business objects used by the Guidewire application,

such as ABContact, Policy, Account, Invoice, Claim

¢ Anentity serves as the root object for PCF files, Gosu Rules and other data

related areas

« Anentity defines a set of entity fields to store information. You can add the

following kinds of fields to an entity:

+ Data
+ Column

* Relationship
+ Foreign key
+ Array
+ Type key

entity
fields

ABContact

Name
EmailAddress1
CreateTime

PrefersContactByEmail
Score

AssignedUser
ContactNotes
ContactTier

| Data fields

Gi

¢ Adata field stores a single value that does not reference any other object or table

¢ Typically defined with the <column> element

¢« Examples of single values:
* Name is a varchar
* CreateTime is a datetime
* PrefersContactByEmail is a bit

* Score is an integer

entity
fields

ABContact

Name
EmailAddress1
CreateTime

PrefersContactByEmail
Score

AssignedUser
ContactNotes
ContactTier

| Foreign key fields G

¢ A foreign key field stores a reference to a related object in the Data Model
¢ Itdefines a unidirectional relationship
¢ AssignedUser in ABContact is the foreign key field for a User

ABContact

Name Credential
EmailAddress1 JobTitle
CreateTime Roles
PrefersContactByEmail we

Score
AssignedUser
ContactNotes
ContactTier

| Array fields G

« An array defines a set of additional entities of the same type to associate with the
main entity

¢ For example, ABContact entity includes an array of ContactNote entities. This
means ABContact can have zero, one or more ContactNotes associated to it.

ABContact ContactNote

TaxID
EmailAddress1

ContactNotes ABContact

| Typelists and typekey fields fa

* Atypelist is a predefined set of possible values that limits the acceptable values for fields
within the application. In most cases a typelist is rendered as a drop-down list in the user
interface

- Atypekey field is entity field that is associated with a specific typelist. It can point to exactly
one value in the typelist

typelist

ABContact

ContactTier

Name

i Platinum
EmailAddress1
" Gold
CreateTime °
Silver

PrefersContactByEmail
Score

AssignedUser
ContactNotes

_ typekey field

Unknown

| Supertype (subtyped) entities

¢ If multiple entities have a common set of fields
then they could be organized into a hierarchy

ABContact

¢ The entities in the same hierarchy will use the
concept of inheritance

* This means that fields and methods of
supertype entities are inherited by subtype
entities

ABAttorney ABDoctor

| Supertype (subtyped) entities example Gi

ABContact

TaxID
EmailAddress1

n 6
InspectionDate

FirstName
LastName

Storage in the database

| Entities in the database

ibcontact* ABContact
1D | Name | CreateTime
Name
64 United Natural Foods Inc 9/4/2009 1:51:32 PM -
— if EmailAddress1
65 aM 94/2009 1:51:32 PM CreateTime
74 Express Auto 9/4/2009 1:51:32 PM PrefersContactByEmail
75 European Autoworks 9/4/2009 1:51:32 PM Score
AssignedUser
76 MBGarage 9/4/2009 1:51:32 PM
—— . i ContactNotes
77 Burlingame Saab 9/4/2009 1:51:32 PM

|__| ContactTier

¢ Often, an entity stores data in a database table named for the entity:
« ABContact entity in ab_abcontact table

¢ Exceptions are...
* Entities that share the columns in an entity table such as a subtype entity

« Virtual, non-persistent entities do not save data to the database. Guidewire recommends that
you do not create non-persistent entities as a general rule

| Data fields in the database G

¢ Data fields can be physical or virtual

* Data model defines physical fields as columns in a database table

* Gosu code defines virtual fields and there is no physical database column

/Table - dbo.ab_abcontact*
FirstName | MiddleName | LastName

am——]_| ten (| MRAE Newton
Bo MULE Simpson

leName

LastName Willian MULL Weeks

FullName (virtual) ‘william MAE Andy

Michael NAL Simpson

FullName = FirstName + " " + MiddleName + " " + LastName

| Foreign key fields in the database

¢ Foreign key fields are stored as foreign key columns

_/ Table - dbo.ab_user*

[1p | FirstNvame LastName
> it Default Owner
i 2 Super User
hs system User

_/ Table - dbo.ab_abcontact*

ID | Name | AssignedUser
64 United Natural Foods Inc

i 65 3M

74 Express Auto

—_ 7S European Autoworks

| Array fields in the database G

« Arrays are not stored in the database, but populated at runtime by queries

¢ Every array on the main entity must have a reverse foreign key pair on the
associated additional entity

ABContact
ContactNote
TaxID
EmailAddress1 Subject

ContactNotes Body
on ABContact

| Typelists and typekey fields in the database G

¢ Each typelist is stored in its own table
« This is a predefined, fixed table that does not change during runtime

¢ Each typekey is a foreign key to a single row in a typelist table

_/ Table - dbo.ab_abcontact*

1D | Name | YendorType 1D,
10001 Auto glass shop

10002 Auto rental service

80 Rent-a-Wreck. 10002 10007 External adjuster
81 Hertz of Menlo Park 10002 10008 Fire inspector

82 Hollister Muffler and Quick Lube 10003 10009 Government aut...

83 Monterey Beacon Village Motor Works 10003 10010 Hospital

| Subtype entities in the database

Gi

¢ Supertype parent table stores all instance of itself AND of subtype data

* Contains parent fields and all subtype fields

* Irrelevant fields are null for specific subtypes

* Application automatically creates typelist table of all subtypes

* Subtype column identifies subtype

¢« Example: FIRSTNAME and LASTNAME are always null for subtype = 3

SELECT ID, TAXID, NAME, FIRSTNAME, LASTNAME, VENDORTYPE, SUBTYPE FROM AB_ABCONTACT order by SUBTYPE;

The Data Dictionary

| What is the Data Dictionary? G

* Documents the entities and typelists in the Guidewire application

* Base application

* Customer extensions © OO fley//C16W07rriningApp/ould/dctonary/dataindex html & 0 6
* Three main sections G . .
. Entities uidewire
ContactManager
. Typelists Data Dictionary
Enty model vein But on 22,208 a 46.1
* All fields DanEatien
tities (Migtation View)
¢ Manual (re)generation Toaltn
All fields (an index of field names to entities containing them)

¢ View in browser

+ ..\build\dictionary
\data\index.html

| Demonstration G

Working with the Data Dictionary

aa==D>
am==D
ap
¢ The developers an Insurance company have learned the
main concepts of the Data Model and want to see how to
click here find more information self-sufficiently

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Question G

,~ — For each of the following, identify if itis stored as a database table, as a
¢ table column, or not stored in the database at all:

A) Anentity (such as ABContact)

B) Aphysical data field (such as ABContact.CreateTime)
C) A virtual data field (such as ABContact.FullName)

D) A foreign key field (such as ABContact.AssignedUser)

¢
¢

Sooo Oooo oo oa

Answer Gi

,~ — For each of the following, identify if itis stored as a database table, as a
¢ table column, or not stored in the database at all:

¢
¢

The correct responses are:
A) Atable
B) Acolumn

C) Not stored in the database (Technically, the source values are probably stored in
the database. But the value of a virtual field itself is not stored as a separate
value.)

Boo OO oo oo ooo

gS

Acolumn (specifically a foreign key column to the relevant entity's table)

Question G

,~ — For each of the following, identify if itis stored as a database table, as a
¢ table column, or not stored in the database at all:

A) Anarray key field (such as ABContact.ContactNotes)
B) Atypelist (such as VendorType)
C) Atypekey field (such as ABContact.VendorType)

¢
¢

Sooo Oooo oo oa

Answer Gi

,~ — For each of the following, identify if itis stored as a database table, as a
¢ table column, or not stored in the database at all:

A) Anarray key field (such as ABContact.ContactNotes)
B) Atypelist (such as VendorType)
C) Atypekey field (such as ABContact.VendorType)

¢
¢

The correct answers are:
A) Not stored in the database,
B) Atable,

C) Acolumn (specifically a foreign key column to the typelist's table)

Boo OO oo oo ooo

Question G

_~ — Name two circumstances in which you would execute the gwb
¢ genDataDictionary command.

¢
¢

Sooo Oooo oo oa

Answer Gi

_~ — Name two circumstances in which you would execute the gwb
¢ genDataDictionary command.

¢
¢

Possible answers:

You would execute genDataDictionary when you install the application and whenever
you extend the Data Model.

You could also execute the command when you modify system permissions or some
other aspect of access and therefore need to regenerate the Security Dictionary.

Boo OO oo oo ooo

review

+ Describe the contents of a Guidewire Data

Model

* Identify information about a given

application's Data Model

+ Use the Data Dictionary

Question G

,~ — For each of the following, identify if itis stored as a database table, as a
¢ table column, or not stored in the database at all:

A) Anentity (such as ABContact)

B) Aphysical data field (such as ABContact.CreateTime)
C) A virtual data field (such as ABContact.FullName)

D) A foreign key field (such as ABContact.AssignedUser)

¢
¢

Sooo Oooo oo oa

Answer Gi

,~ — For each of the following, identify if itis stored as a database table, as a
¢ table column, or not stored in the database at all:

¢
¢

The correct responses are:
A) Atable
B) Acolumn

C) Not stored in the database (Technically, the source values are probably stored in
the database. But the value of a virtual field itself is not stored as a separate
value.)

Boo OO oo oo ooo

gS

Acolumn (specifically a foreign key column to the relevant entity's table)

Question G

,~ — For each of the following, identify if itis stored as a database table, as a
¢ table column, or not stored in the database at all:

A) Anarray key field (such as ABContact.ContactNotes)
B) Atypelist (such as VendorType)
C) Atypekey field (such as ABContact.VendorType)

¢
¢

Sooo Oooo oo oa

Answer Gi

,~ — For each of the following, identify if itis stored as a database table, as a
¢ table column, or not stored in the database at all:

A) Anarray key field (such as ABContact.ContactNotes)
B) Atypelist (such as VendorType)
C) Atypekey field (such as ABContact.VendorType)

¢
¢

The correct answers are:
A) Not stored in the database,
B) Atable,

C) Acolumn (specifically a foreign key column to the typelist's table)
